alert.note: Alert for Lee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 03 at 5:49PM CDT until August 03 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR LEE COUNTY... At 549 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of River View to near Tuskegee National Forest, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Auburn, Opelika, Notasulga, Smiths, Smiths Station, Beulah, Beans Mill, Auburn University, Beauregard, Bleecker, Griffen Mill, Ladonia, Loachapoka, Robert G. Pitts Airport, Monterey Heights, Chewacla State Park and Marvyn. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
